channel.title: News on WISS | Stuttgart Media University
channel.description: Recent content in News on WISS | Stuttgart Media University

item.title: BibCamp 2016
item.description:
BibCamp 2016 takes place April 8th and 9th 2016 at Stuttgart Media University and is organized by our students. BibCamp is a barcamp or unconference, where practitioners and researchers from the field of information science gather to discuss various topics.

The registration is open at Eventbrite!

Everything important you can find at the BibCamp website.

item.title: DFG grant for FID Judaica
item.description:
We are very happy that our project proposal for an expert information servide got accepted for funding by the German Science Foundation (DFG).

With an overall funding of over 1 Mio Euro (with about 280.000 Euro for our group), we will develop together with our partner, the University Library Johann Christian Senckenberg, Frankfurt, an expert information service for the Judaica domain. Our group is mainly responsible for the data integration and enrichment.

Read more about the project on the dedicated page.

Stuttgart Media University also provides a press release in German.

item.title: Winter Break 2016
item.description: We wish all our student all the best for the upcoming exams and of course a happy winter break! We hope to welcome you back in our summer semester lectures.

item.title: InFoLiS at SWIB conference
item.description:
At the upcoming Semantic Web in Libraries (SWIB) conference in Hamburg, we will present the RESTful JSON-LD Architecture deveoped within the InFoLiS project.

Update: Slides online!

The slides for our presentation A RESTful JSON-LD Architecture for Unraveling Hidden References to Research Data at the 2015 SWIB conference in Hamburg are available on Speakerdeck.

item.title: InFoLiS at ELAG 2015
item.description:
At the upcoming ELAG conference in Stockholm, we will present the InFoLiS project.

Update: Video online!

A video of our talk on InFoLiS at this year’s ELAG conference in Stockholm, Sweden is now online at YouTube:

ELAG 2015 InFoLiS 2 – Making data citations a reality
